00067 /************ FMB_Info: ***********/
00068 typedef struct{
00069 
00070   REAL_T dt;  /* 0.001 */
00071   REAL_T tend ; /*0.001 */ 
00072 
00073   long nb_bodies; /* for this process only */
00074   long total_nb_bodies; /* sum of 'FMB_Info.nb_bodies' over all MPI processes */
00075 
00076 
00077   REAL_T eps_soft; /* Softening parameter ('epsilon') in gravitational computations. */
00078   REAL_T eps_soft_square; /* eps_soft_square = eps_soft . eps_soft */ 
00079   
00080   bool save; /* If set to TRUE, we save position, mass, force and/or potential of all particles.
00081               * Default value: FALSE. */
00082 
00083   bool sum;  /* If set to TRUE, we compute and display the sum of the forces and/or potential over all particles.
00084               * Default value: FALSE. */
00085 
00086 } FMB_Info_t;

00104 /***** Equality between floating point numbers: (for position_Are_too_close()) *****/
00105 /*** 1st method: ***
00106  * #define GAP_TOLERATED_FOR_POSITIONS 0.0000000001 /\* 10^(-10) *\/ 
00107  * And then test like: (FMB_FABS(position_Get_x(p1) - position_Get_x(p2)) < GAP_TOLERATED_FOR_POSITIONS)   */
00108 /*** 2nd method: ***
00109  * WARNING: this is not optimal (see "Comparing floating point numbers", Bruce Dawson
00110  * (http://www.cygnus-software.com/papers/comparingfloats/comparingfloats.htm)). */
00111 #define COORDINATES_T_MAX_RELATIVE_ERROR 0.00001 /* default value for 'maxRelativeError' */
00112 FMB_INLINE bool COORDINATES_T__ARE_ALMOST_EQUAL(COORDINATES_T A, COORDINATES_T B, COORDINATES_T maxRelativeError){
00113   COORDINATES_T relativeError;
00114   if (FMB_FABS(A - B) < COORDINATES_T_MIN){
00115     return TRUE;
00116   }
00117   if (FMB_FABS(B) > FMB_FABS(A)){
00118     relativeError = FMB_FABS((A - B) / B);
00119   }
00120   else {
00121     relativeError = FMB_FABS((A - B) / A);
00122   }
00123   if (relativeError <= maxRelativeError){
00124     return TRUE;
00125   }
00126   return FALSE;
00127 }

00134 /* #define COMPUTATIONAL_BOX_MARGIN 0.0 /\* The body do not move (only 1 time step). *\/ */

00139 /* Numbering of the cell's children : */
00140 /* 3D : FRONT-BACK UP-DOWN LEFT-RIGHT */
00141 /* Direct correspondence with Morton ordering: */
00142 typedef enum children_number_t {
00143   BDL, BUL, BDR, BUR, FDL, FUL, FDR, FUR
00144 } children_number_t;
00145 #define FIRST_CHILDREN_NUMBER BDL
00146 #define LAST_CHILDREN_NUMBER FUR

00151 #define CHILDREN_BITS_NUMBER 3
00152 #define NB_NEAREST_NEIGHBORS 26 /* for uniform distributions only */
00153 #define SIZE_INTERACTION_LIST 189 
00154 /* When we exclude the second nearest neighbors too: */

00165 /* Numbering of the nearest neighbors: */
00166 /* 3D : FACE-EDGE-VERTEX FRONT-BACK UP-DOWN LEFT-RIGHT */
00167 /* Rules: F>E>V and F>B>U>D>L>R */
00168 typedef enum neighbor_number_t {
00169   F_F, F_B, F_U, F_D, F_L, F_R, 
00170   E_FU, E_FD, E_BU, E_BD, E_FL, E_FR, E_BL, E_BR, E_UL, E_UR, E_DL, E_DR,
00171   V_FUL, V_FUR, V_FDL, V_FDR, V_BUL, V_BUR, V_BDL, V_BDR
00172 } neighbor_number_t;
00173 #define FIRST_NEIGHBOR_NUMBER F_F
00174 #define LAST_NEIGHBOR_NUMBER V_BDR
00175 /* #define F_F 0 */
00176 /* #define F_B 1 */
00177 /* #define F_U 2 */
00178 /* #define F_D 3 */
00179 /* #define F_L 4 */
00180 /* #define F_R 5 */
00181 /* #define E_FU 6 */
00182 /* #define E_FD 7 */
00183 /* #define E_BU 8 */
00184 /* #define E_BD 9 */
00185 /* #define E_FL 10 */
00186 /* #define E_FR 11 */
00187 /* #define E_BL 12 */
00188 /* #define E_BR 13 */
00189 /* #define E_UL 14 */
00190 /* #define E_UR 15 */
00191 /* #define E_DL 16 */
00192 /* #define E_DR 17 */
00193 /* #define V_FUL 18 */
00194 /* #define V_FUR 19 */
00195 /* #define V_FDL 20 */
00196 /* #define V_FDR 21 */
00197 /* #define V_BUL 22 */
00198 /* #define V_BUR 23 */
00199 /* #define V_BDL 24 */
00200 /* #define V_BDR 25 */
00201 FMB_INLINE bool is_Face_neighbor(neighbor_number_t nn){
00202   /* return ((nn <= F_R) ? TRUE : FALSE), => useless */
00203   return nn <= F_R;
00204 }
00205 FMB_INLINE bool is_Vertex_neighbor(neighbor_number_t nn){
00206   /* return ((nn >= V_FUL) ? TRUE : FALSE), => useless */
00207   return nn >= V_FUL;
00208 }

00229 /***** To sort the "results" files: *****/
00230 #ifdef __AIX__
00231 /* The maximum number of fields of the 'sort' command on AIX 5.1 is 10, 
00232  * which is not enough: the 'sort command' fails for large files ... 
00233  * Use: ~/bin/gnu_sort.sh */
00234 #define SORT_COMMANDE_FORMAT "sort -o %s -n -k 7,7 %s "
00235 #endif /* __AIX__ */
00236 
00237 #ifdef __LINUX__
00238 /* The sorting fails with '-n' on pollux ... */
00239 #define SORT_COMMANDE_FORMAT "sort -o %s -k 7,7 %s "
00240 #endif /* __LINUX__ */
